result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam R Schmitt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Alter Identification, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(3)(b).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution due in 90 days and will be forwarded to District Atty's office for direct payment to the victim. Failure to pay 1 day jail for every $25 owed.  
The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Cts 1-3: Court costs and balance of Atty fees ($150 applied) due by continued payment plan of $100 a month beginning 4/15/16. Failure to pay 1 day jail for every $25 owed.
Pay supervision fees.
  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

records.descr: Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: for attorney fees - forwarded to branch

Defendant Adam R Schmitt in court with attorney Robert P Olmr.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case to be recalled. 
Recalled, same appearances.  Plea questionaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.

Defendant Adam R Schmitt in court with attorney Robert P Olmr.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case originally scheduled for Plea/Sentencing Hearing. Counsel requests adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Adam R Schmitt in court with attorney Robert P Olmr.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter scheduled for plea/sentencing, however, counsel advises court that defendant's employment terminates 10/20/15 and will not receive huber, requesting adj of dispo.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Adam R Schmitt in court with Attorney Robert P Olmr.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel advises this matter has not had a pretrial and requests an adjournment.
Court grants the request.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Adam R Schmitt in court with attorney Robert P Olmr.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel receives copy of complaint. Waiver of preliminary hearing filed. Court examines defendant, accepts waiver and binds matter over for trial. State files information. Defense waives reading of information and enters plea of not guilty.  Further proceedings scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Atty Olmr will accept court appointment. All pertinent documents forwarded this date.

Defendant Adam R Schmitt in court.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter set for status on preliminary hearing. Defendant does not qualify for public defender and still requesting court appointed attorney. Affidavit of indigency previously filed. Court does not find defendant to be indigent and will appoint with payment  of $100 a month beginning 8/14/15.  Status hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 01:45 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Adam R Schmitt in court.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advises does not qualify for public defender representation.  Defendant indicates unable to retain Atty Stansbury, Atty Ken Kratz, Atty George Limbeck.  Court examines defendant.  Court does not find defendant indigent based on petition and will not appoint counsel.  Court adjourns matter for an additional 30 days to retain counsel.  Court continues to waive timelimits.  Status hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Adam R Schmitt in court.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant requesting more time to obtain the retainer for Atty Stansbury. Court grants one last adjournment and finds good cause to extend time limits.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Adam R Schmitt in court.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court advises of penalties and finds probable cause. Defendant will be hiring Atty Doug Stansbury. Court finds good cause to extend timelimits for defendant to hire counsel. State requesting $2000.00 signature bond with conditions. Defendant to be booked for ATN#  Status hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Initial appearance on April 14, 2015 at 08:15 am.
